title: 'Dr. cheddar doesn't respect me': Man has an adorable meltdown about his cat while inebriated, seeking help from purrfessionals
description: We think that every cat owner has been through this moment. Sure, we know that our cats love us deeply. We know it, we have seen it, we believe it, but… as new cat owners, way back in the day, we did wonder, for a mere few seconds, if cats really love their humans that much. Yup, we fell for the propaganda too. We didn't know better. When our cat bit us for the first time, we thought that was it, the cat hated us. Now, things are different, of course, but we still understand that deep, deep fear. We're not going to lie though. As much as we understand the fear, it was still funny as heck for us to come across this thread. Someone tell this man that cats appreciate us and love us and care for us very, very much. Their ways of showing it might simply be a little funny sometimes, and that is okay, we promise. There is no need for mental breakdowns over the subject. But if you do have any more of them, please post them too.
author: Mariel Ruvinsky
excerpt: 'Dr. cheddar doesn't respect me': Man has an adorable meltdown about his cat while inebriated, seeking help from purrfessionals - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: You know what… we don't think we have seen any customer service ever be this nice to literally anyone. This is a good experience. And a good cat owner. Wholesomeness all around, combined with a hint of hilarity. These are the kinds of stories that we want to see all throughout 2025.  And that's the real question, isn't it? We need to know what the misunderstanding is. We need to know the drama that caused this poor person to have such a reaction. We need to know what Dr. Cheddar said to make this person feel so heckin' bad. Oh, the drama. So juicy.
html:
You know what… we don't think we have seen any customer service ever be this nice to literally anyone. This is a good experience. And a good cat owner. Wholesomeness all around, combined with a hint of hilarity. These are the kinds of stories that we want to see all throughout 2025. 

And that's the real question, isn't it? We need to know what the misunderstanding is. We need to know the drama that caused this poor person to have such a reaction. We need to know what Dr. Cheddar said to make this person feel so heckin' bad. Oh, the drama. So juicy.
